headline.main: AFFAIRS IN ILLINOIS.; The Forward Movement--Inlishments--The Constitutional Convention--Cotton and Sorhum--Mortality--From the West.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our people have been aroused within the past few days into something like animated satisfaction, in view of active operations of a portion, at least, of our grand army. The announcement that an expedition of considerable magnitude had actually got under way from Cairo and the adjacent ports, created almost an enthusiasm in this city. headline.main: BUSINESS BEFORE THE LEGISLATURE; Bills in Senate. PAYMENTS OF DIVIDENDS. THE METROPOLITAN HEALTH DISTRICT. LEGALIZING ACTS OF THE COMMON COUNCIL. THE COURT OF CHANCERY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. BELL'S bill amending the act authorizing Notaries Public of the State of New-York to perform the duties now performed by Commissioners of Deeds, by adding after the words "Commissioners of Deeds." the words, "and Justices of the Peace in the several counties in the State."

docs.snippet: A lady, says the Charleston Mercury one of the hundreds who have fled to Virginia from beyond the Potomac sends to us the following narrative of facts, which may serve as an instance of the unconquerable spirit of the women of Baltimore, under the...
docs.lead_paragraph: A lady, says the Charleston Mercury one of the hundreds who have fled to Virginia from beyond the Potomac sends to us the following narrative of facts, which may serve as an instance of the unconquerable spirit of the women of Baltimore, under the petty outrages to whick they are continually subjected by the brutal Yankee soldiery:

docs.snippet: Yesterday the Seventh New-Hampshire Regisment, Col. H.S. PUTNAM, arrived in this City from Manchester. It numbers 1,000 men, all of whom are armed and equipped. The regiment will remain in this City until further orders.
docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday the Seventh New-Hampshire Regisment, Col. H.S. PUTNAM, arrived in this City from Manchester. It numbers 1,000 men, all of whom are armed and equipped. The regiment will remain in this City until further orders.

docs.snippet: The mor tality of New-York City during the year just closed is quite up to the frightful radio of previous years. The total number of deaths was 22,117, being, says the City Inspector, as compared with the preceding year, a decrease of 593 deaths.
docs.lead_paragraph: The mor tality of New-York City during the year just closed is quite up to the frightful radio of previous years. The total number of deaths was 22,117, being, says the City Inspector, as compared with the preceding year, a decrease of 593 deaths.

headline.main: CITY INSPECTOR'S ANNUAL REPORT.; CONDITION OF STREETS AND PAVEMENTS. CAUSES OF DISEASE. TENEMENT HOUSES. CONCERNING PHILADELPHIA. SEWERAGE AND DRAINAGE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The report of the City Inspector, for last year, was laid before the Common Council on Monday. Much irrelevant matter is introduced, and much of the ground which has been gone over in previous years is traversed once more. We publish all that is of value:

docs.snippet: Mr. MUNRO gave notice of a bill to amend the Harbor Master's Act.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. MUNRO gave notice of a bill to amend the Harbor Master's Act.
